    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Precentor</h1>Velstrac storytellers and historians are known as precentors. Trailed by horrific choirs, precentors perform in the courts of the velstrac demagogues.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 37<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=463">Precentor</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 16</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Precentor.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Precentor.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><span alt="Velstrac Trait" class="trait" title="<i>Note from Nethys: no description was provided for this trait</i>"><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=265">Velstrac</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 85</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +32; darkvision, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=66"><i>detect magic</i></a>, painsight, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=344"><i>true seeing</i></a><br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=21"><u>Shadowtongue</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +27, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +28, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=6"><u>Diplomacy</a></u> +34, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +32, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=12"><u>Performance</a></u> +34, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +30, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +29, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Torture Lore</a></u> +26<br /><b>Str</b> +6, <b>Dex</b> +7, <b>Con</b> +3, <b>Int</b> +6, <b>Wis</b> +6, <b>Cha</b> +8<br /><b>Painsight</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=47">divination</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>) A precentor automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=11">dying</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42">wounded</a> conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.<hr /><b>AC</b> 39, <b>Fort</b> +25, <b>Ref</b> +29, <b>Will</b> +30; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 295, regeneration 25 (deactivated by good or silver); <b>Immunities</b> cold; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 20, silver 20<br /><b>Unnerving Gaze</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=163">visual</a>) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed 1</a>.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 30 feet, fly 30 feet (from <i><a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=125">fly</a></i>)<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +31 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 4d10+6 slashing plus 1d6 persistent bleed</span><b>Divine Innate Spells</b> DC 38; <b>9th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=361">wail of the banshee</a></u></i>; <b>8th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=146">harm</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=222">plane shift</a></u></i> (at will, self only, to the Material or Shadow Plane only); <b>5th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=292">sound burst</a></u></i> (at will), <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=328">synesthesia</a></u></i> (at will); <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(8th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=61">daze</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=286">sigil</a></u></i>; <b>Constant</b> <b>(8th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=192">mind blank</a></u></i>; <b>(6th)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=125">fly</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=344">true seeing</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Assemble Choir</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  The precentor adds a creature that is affected by its Tormenting Touch and is within 100 feet to its choir of screams. A precentor can have any number of creatures in its choir, although a creature no longer affected by Tormenting Touch leaves the choir immediately. Creatures in a precentor’s choir of screams are <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=14">fascinated</a> by each other and the precentor, and they can’t use hostile actions toward each other or the precentor. When the precentor casts an innate divine spell, it can cause the effect to originate from any member of its choir instead of itself, using the precentor’s saving throw DC and attack bonus.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Focus Gaze</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=163"><u>visual</a></u>) The precentor stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the precentor’s unnerving gaze. In addition, if the creature was already <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>, on a failed save, it sees the skin of its own body peel back, making it <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=5">confused</a> for as long as it remains <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the precentor’s next turn. </span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Tormenting Touch</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=60"><u>emotion</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>) The precentor touches a creature within 10 feet, causing it to constantly scream in agony. The target must attempt a DC 38 Will save. While the target is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied</a> by this effect, its continual screams cause it to automatically fail Stealth checks.<br /> <b>Critical Success</b> The target is unaffected.<br /> <b>Success</b> The target is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied 1</a>.<br /> <b>Failure</b> The target is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied 3</a>.<br /> <b>Critical Failure</b> The target is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied 4</a>.<br /> The target can attempt a new Will save at the start of each of its turns, reducing the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied</a> condition by 1 on each successful save. If the target reduces its <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=37">stupefied</a> condition to 0 in this way, the target is no longer affected.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=460">Augur</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=461">Evangelist</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=462">Interlocutor</a></td><td>12</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=463">Precentor</a></td><td>16</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 82</i></a><br />Velstracs are horrific, shadow-dwelling fiends who seek ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of debasement and torture before then turning their knives on themselves. Although velstracs consider themselves beyond such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict debased, sadistic suffering. They claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don’t recognize any refinement that doesn’t require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.<br /><br /> Velstracs manifest from the souls of masochistic or sadistic mortals that are diverted into the Shadow Plane and then forged into forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the aesthetics-obsessed interlocutors.<br /><br /> Some mortals refer to velstracs as “kytons,” a misattribution that the velstracs tolerate with cold amusement. The term “kyton” denotes a master or virtuoso among their kind, and these fiends enjoy being labeled masters of their horrid paths to perfection through agony.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Despicable Origins</h3>Velstracs originated with the first debased thoughts of mortals, which the gods found so deplorable that they locked all velstracs away in Hell. It wasn’t long, however, before the newly formed race of velstracs escaped their infernal prison to the Shadow Plane.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Velstracs</h3>Scholars grimly joke that there are as many different kinds of velstracs as there are ways to skin a cat. The relatively diminutive cantor velstrac poisons the minds of its victims so that they believe they are being clawed from the inside out. The mighty eremites, on the other hand, seek out the most powerful beings to subsume into their own form and lord over all other velstracs save the demagogues.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> The Shadow Forge</h3>Many velstracs forge their own chains, but others outsource the task to unique velstracs known as almoners. These blind, deaf, and mute velstracs resemble six-armed halflings severed at the waist that toil away endlessly at a great burning foundry called the Shadow Forge. Almoners operate under mysterious strictures, and are just as likely to turn a velstrac away empty-handed as they are to hand one a finely crafted chain before the request has even been uttered.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Velstrac Divinities</h3>The most powerful velstracs are unique divinities known collectively as demagogues—powerful creatures often worshipped by mortals who seek to experience agonizing new revelations and gain power by enhancing the body through pain.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
